1. Push-ups: This classic exercise targets your chest, shoulders, and triceps. To make it easier, you can start with push-ups against a wall or on your knees. As you get stronger, progress to regular push-ups.

2. Tricep dips: Using a sturdy chair or bench, you can perform tricep dips to target your triceps. Make sure to keep your back close to the bench and lower your body until your arms are at a 90-degree angle.

3. Plank to downward dog: This exercise targets your shoulders, arms, and core. Start in a plank position, then lift your hips and move into a downward dog position. Hold for a few seconds, then return to the plank position.

4. Countertop rows: Using a sturdy counter or table, you can perform rows to target your back muscles. Make sure to keep your back straight and pull your shoulder blades together as you lift your body.

5. Diamond push-ups: This variation of push-ups targets your triceps even more. Form a diamond shape with your thumbs and index fingers, then perform push-ups as usual.
